website_summaries.verdict: A beautiful and classic wood flower press that is as aesthetically pleasing as it is fun to use.
pros: Non-toxic materials and ecologically sourced wood
A great product for younger children but also enjoyed by adult crafters
Smaller at 7" x 7" but still allows you to press multiple flowers at a time
cons: Doesn’t come with directions, so beginners must source instructions elsewhere
Small parts not ideal for unsupervised children

customer_reviews.title: Thrilled with results!
customer_reviews.text: The kit is cute and very good quality. Only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is because it doesn't come with directions. I bought this for my grandmother's 94th birthday. I often find pressed flowers or leaves in her old books. She has some dementia so she couldn't understand what it was, but today we opened the press after 4 weeks of waiting and we were both thrilled with the results! I bought "create your own" buttons for a couple bucks, took the pin out and we're using them as coasters. They look so beautiful, they don't even look real!
customer_reviews.author: Cassie

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful press. I got it for my 3 year old because she has recently become very interested in collecting all the flowers. We will enjoy this together for a long time!
customer_reviews.author: KD

customer_reviews.title: because while it is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why it's called a toy, because while it is easy to use, there are a lot of small parts I wouldn't leave young children alone with. But as an adult who wants to press flowers for crafts, this is PERFECT. It is somewhat small, so it doesn't take up a lot of space, but still allows you to press quite a quantity of plants at a time. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: pamela

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy for nature loving kids.
customer_reviews.text: This is nice flower press. My 5 year old is able to use it on her own without assistance. The wing nuts are a little tricky, but she can handle them. We've done 3 or 4 bunches of flowers and ferns all with good results. You can use the paper between the cardboard presses again and again. We have made than you cards and other art projects with the pressed flowers
customer_reviews.author: J Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Excellent flower press
customer_reviews.text: Excellent flower press. Very strong and a very good starter kit. Only con: If you have never pressed flowers before, you should look for directions as this kit didn't come with proper directions if you are a beginner, but the "How To" aspect is pretty easy to find online and in books which is why I still gave 5 stars
customer_reviews.author: Brooke

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful! The wood is really solid and I love ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely beautiful! The wood is really solid and I love the simplistic art on the front! This was a birthday gift for my 9 year old who had broken her previous flower press. The size if perfect for all of her flowers and leaves that collects, everything dries really evenly and it is holding up very well. It still looks brand new even after 5 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Chris & Jillian

customer_reviews.title: Perfect flower press
customer_reviews.text: I had one of these as a child and when my grandmother passed away recently, I wanted to save some of the flowers from her yard and this was perfect.
customer_reviews.author: WestGhent

customer_reviews.title: Well made, fun activity with child
customer_reviews.text: Really cute item. It was a gift for my 3 year old in her easter basket. We are enjoying looking for little flowers on our walk to add to the press. Our first round of pressed flowers came out beautifully and I can't wait to see what we have by the end of the summer!
customer_reviews.author: Ellen C.

customer_reviews.title: Great for anyone who loves to flower press.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly like the picture. I did have one flower stick to the lining between the cardboard. Next time I will try to ass wax paper.
customer_reviews.author: HereIAm

customer_reviews.title: Awesome first press.
customer_reviews.text: Been using books, this was a great step up and introduction to flower presses. The wood is more flexible than it probably should be, and I was surprised to find that I'd like it a bit larger. I'll probably make my own press next time, but hard to knock this one. It is what it promotes itself as.
customer_reviews.author: David R.

customer_reviews.title: Too difficult for young children
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year-old twins never would have been able to use this on their own. Twisting the screws to open the press was hard enough for an adult, there is no way a kid could use this. It is nice to see an old-fashioned wood and screw press, but if you're considering it, know that you'll have to help open and close it.
customer_reviews.author: KEC

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Just lovely! Very excited to use with my three year old. No instructions included :/
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Chamberlain

customer_reviews.title: It made a sweet gift for my 8 year old niece
customer_reviews.text: Cute toy. It made a sweet gift for my 8 year old niece.
customer_reviews.author: Autumn

customer_reviews.title: Love collecting spring and early summer flowers and leaves to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are hard to find! Love collecting spring and early summer flowers and leaves to frame in the winter. Looking forward to this year's batch! No need to stain my book pages anymore
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a book press
customer_reviews.text: I use it to press little books that I make. It works perfectly and it was a great price. Plus I like the cute illustration.
customer_reviews.author: Mitra Farmand

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: FAST & SMOOTH SERVICE - GREAT ITEM LOVE IT, THANKS!
customer_reviews.author: D.Gotel

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Little Flowerpress
customer_reviews.text: It presses flowers beautifully. It’s the second one we’ve purchased as gifts and the recipients have lived them.
customer_reviews.author: ViLiMe

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and timeless
customer_reviews.text: We are really enjoying this flower press. Great quality and timeless. Love that it's not plastic.
customer_reviews.author: Smittendogo21

customer_reviews.title: Not only a great flower press
customer_reviews.text: Not only a great flower press; the design on the top makes it attractive enough to leave out and im'press' your friends!
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Nice product. It is good for pressing small leaves ...
customer_reviews.text: Nice product. It is good for pressing small leaves and flowers.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Still cute but this is what I received vs the picture on amazon. Oh well...
customer_reviews.author: Autumn Pearson

customer_reviews.title: Bummer
customer_reviews.text: I have a small flower press and was looking for another. The wing nuts and washers makes this press inconvenient and time consuming to open and close. It might be better if it had clips or something instead. Especially if this item is meant for kids! It has small peices that might be choking hazards or at least can be very easily lost. I was also disappointed to see that it only had paper and cardboard inside. I was expecting felt and linen paper in addition. You could make one of these yourself easily. Maybe my standards are too high :(
customer_reviews.author: LittleDuck

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super disappointed I didn’t get the one in the picture. Everything else is great about it and would of given it 5 stars if I had gotten the one I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Moulin Roty Le Jardin Flower Press
product_meta.description:
About the Brand

Moulin Roty is a French toy company that had produced award-winning toys for over 40 years, and has charmed the youngest members of millions of families across the globe to date.

History

Moulin Roty is a tiny communal village in western France founded in 1972 as a quest for a healthier and more rewarding lifestyle. In 1975 The Moulin Roty Toy Company launched 2 toys: a car made of wood and sponge, and a soft rag doll named "la douillette" that charmed everyone with its originality. In 1980 Moulin Roty became a worker-owned cooperative. To ensure the development and the durability of the company, the founding members adopted the status of co-op (SCOP in French) to preserve the founding values of the brand: solidarity, sharing and respect.

Materials

Moulin Roty searches for the very best materials, selecting most of their fabrics from France and the rest from Europe because of their design and technical quality, as well as their non-toxicity. (Oeko-Tex certified). All solid wood used, mainly beech wood, comes from forests that are managed ecologically and that respect quotas for felling and re-planting.
feature_bullets: Designed in France, for aspiring botanists, this press is perfect for drying flowers and intricate leaves that children collect.
Recommended for children from 3 years and up.
Size: 7 in x 7 in x 7 in.
French collection: Moulin Roty Le Jardin du Moulin - Presse a Fleurs
